content.title: National Solar Science Fellowship Programme
content.department: Ministry Of New and Renewable Energy
content.beneficiary: Scientists and Engineers in Solar Energy Research
content.details: The “National Solar Science Fellowship Programme” of the Ministry of New & Renewable Energy was launched in February 2011. The programme is meant for an Indian Scientist desirous of working in the forefront areas of solar energy science, engineering, and technology with a focus on science, technology, and product development in collaboration with selected prestigious institutions in India. The aim of the National Solar Science Fellowship Programme is to provide a platform to top quality scientists and engineers in the area of solar energy research, to use and expand the resources available at the identified schools/ institutions in the country and abroad to address the complex problems of solar energy utilization for various end uses including power generation.
benefits: Each selected Fellow will receive a total annual grant of up to ₹32.00 lakhs comprising (i) emolument of up to ₹12.00 lakhs (ii) contingencies of up to ₹5.00 lakhs and (iii) research grant of up to ₹15.00 lakhs.
The grant will be released to the host institution for being granted to the Fellow.
The Fellow may also raise additional resources from other sources such as the host Institution, grant providers, grant-in-aid Institutions, etc.
eligibility: The applicant should be Indian or of Indian origin.

The programme is open to all Scientists working in the field of solar energy sciences, engineering, and technology including those currently employed in the Government of India/ State Government/Public Institutions.

The applicant should possess a doctorate or equivalent in the field of solar sciences/solar engineering, with an outstanding track record and proven leadership qualities in the area of solar energy research with experience of at least ten years.
M.Tech. or M.S degree holder with good published work and lab/industry experience will also be considered as a special case.
The applicant should have an appropriate background in academics and experience in R&D in the area of solar energy.
There will be no age bar for the Programme.
content.application_process: Applications from talented scientists having proven records in any field of solar science, or engineering will be invited through open advertisement. The application should be as per the instructions for filling up the Proforma given in the Guidelines.
documents_required: Details of any awards/recognition received in the subject area at the national/international level
Details of Scientific/technical papers published in the relevant subject area

faqs.question: What is the aim of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The aim of the scheme is to provide a platform to top quality scientists and engineers in the area of solar energy research.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Ministry of New & Renewable Energy, Government of India.

faqs.question: When was this scheme launched?
faqs.answer: The “National Solar Science Fellowship Programme” was launched in February 2011.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to get the benefits under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The programme is open to all Scientists working in the field of solar energy sciences, engineering, and technology.

faqs.question: Can a general category applicant be eligible to apply under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, this scheme is for all categories of applicants.

faqs.question: What is the minimum qualification required to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The applicant should possess Post-Graduation, PhD & Post-Doctoral degree to apply under the scheme.

faqs.question: Can an M.Tech. or M.S. degree holder candidate be eligible to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, an M.Tech. or M.S degree holder with good published work and lab/industry experience will also be considered.

faqs.question: Is it mandatory for a candidate to have an appropriate background in academics and experience in R&D in the area of solar energy?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant should have an appropriate background in academics and experience in R&D.

faqs.question: Will there be any age bar for the candidates to apply under the programme?
faqs.answer: No, there will be no age bar for the programme.

faqs.question: What is the benefit of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Each selected Fellow will receive a total annual grant of up to ₹32.00 lakhs.

faqs.question: How many numbers of fellowships will be awarded at a time?
faqs.answer: The total number of fellowships at any point of time will be limited to 10 only.

faqs.question: What should be the duration of the fellowship?
faqs.answer: The duration of the fellowship will be initially for two years which may be extended for another three more years.

faqs.question: How can a candidate apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The eligible candidate may apply offline mode.
